ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
Mixbox is a new blending method for natural color mixing. It produces saturated gradients with hue shifts and natural secondary colors during blending.
Yellow and blue make green. The interface is simple - RGB in, RGB out.
Internally, Mixbox treats colors as real-life pigments using the Kubelka & Munk theory to predict realistic color behavior.
That way, colors act like actual paints and bring more vibrance and intuition into digital painting.

Mixbox is a new blending method for natural color mixing. It produces saturated gradients with hue shifts and natural secondary colors during blending.
Yellow and blue make green. The interface is simple - RGB in, RGB out.
Internally, Mixbox treats colors as real-life pigments using the Kubelka & Munk theory to predict realistic color behavior.
That way, colors act like actual paints and bring more vibrance and intuition into digital painting.

name: pymixbox
raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  name: pymixbox
  version: "2.0.0"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/p/pymixbox/pymixbox-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7f1fc8e950778efedfc20bbeeaf240576baca06726b3ce83a97ce507f226aee4

build:
  noarch: python
  script: python -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - pip
    - setuptools >=61.0.0
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
      - mixbox
      pip_check: true
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*

about:
  homepage: https://scrtwpns.com/mixbox/
  summary: 'Pigment-Based Color Mixing'
  description: |
    Mixbox is a new blending method for natural color mixing. It produces saturated gradients with hue shifts and natural secondary colors during blending.
    Yellow and blue make green. The interface is simple - RGB in, RGB out.
    Internally, Mixbox treats colors as real-life pigments using the Kubelka & Munk theory to predict realistic color behavior.
    That way, colors act like actual paints and bring more vibrance and intuition into digital painting.
  license: CC-BY-NC-4.0
  license_file: LICENSE
  repository: https://github.com/scrtwpns/mixbox

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - claudiushaag
